meanings.definition: A type of aircraft designed for sustained flight without an engine, relying on air currents for lift.
meanings.sent1: Sailplanes gracefully glide through the sky using air currents for lift.
meanings.sent2: The sailplanes soared silently above the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The sailplanes had a race to see who could stay in the air the longest.
meanings.sent4: Watching the sailplanes dance with the wind is like witnessing poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sailplanes against the blue sky was truly mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: I learned how to sailplanes last summer and it was exhilarating.
meanings.sent2: She sailplanes every weekend to experience the freedom of the open sky.
meanings.sent3: The pilot decided to sailplanes upside down just for fun.
meanings.sent4: His dreams sailplanes through the clouds, reaching new heights of imagination.
meanings.sent5: As she sailplanes, she feels like a bird soaring high above the world.
